intro: Erythroxylum glaucocladum, commonly known as the blue-leaved copal tree, is a species of flowering plant in the mallow family, Malvaceae. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in regions of Mexico, Guatemala, and Costa Rica. The plant is characterized by its glaucous, waxy leaves that give it a distinctive blue-gray appearance. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Erythroxylum glaucocladum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and aesthetic appeal.
